column4: I'm finnaly here... Just installed ubuntu warty for my hoe server and I'm a bit disapointed....
got me ages to find out how to configure my adsl connectio...
do I have to stick with openoffice, I'd like it uninstalled but It always complains of ubuntu-desktop dependency, at least
after all this is a server
why do I HAVE to stick with a bunch of packages I dont wan't because of ubuntu-desktop.... Stupid dependency....
you can remove the ubuntu-desktop package
thoght that was the desktop I'm at...
it's a dummy package
just dependencies
k, thanks
but if new packages are added to it, you won't get them with a regular update if you don't have ubuntu-desktop installed. just be aware of that
has I said, stupid dependency
*as
added to it? what? ubuntu-desktop?
- the packaged 'ubuntu-desktop' is just dependencies - it's a way of keeping all of the packages involved with the standard ubuntu desktop in one place...
however, if you remove it, nothing will be removed from your system

on the other hand, if you update your system and you don't have the ubuntu-desktop package installed, you may not get new dependent packages that the maintainers later add to their idea of the "standard ubuntu desktop"
if that makes sense... phew
will I still be able to install updates?
yes
s0oundt3ch, i'm a little nervous for you now. if you don't know this, maybe you shouldn't be messing with these things :)
well, they should add to their ideas that someone might just wan't a server, withoud the desktop(all of them at leas) apps...
